author: Konstantin1996
message:
2454-after-clicking-undo-button-edit-abbreviation-popup-do-not-appear (#2464)

The problem was connected with incorrect keys for functionalGroup
After we click on undo action or press Ctrl+z
functionalGroups and sgroups maps has different id's in maps
You can check it by using ketcher.editor.struct() in console.
Seems different id's for sgroup and functionalGroup breaks undo() sometimes.
Previously id's for sgroup and functionalGroups were the same

To solve the problem I took key instead of id inside functionalGroup map

- created findKeyOfRelatedGroupId that delivers correct id for functionalGroup
- created getters struct / functionalGroup and other to not create same constants everytime
- refactored code

Co-authored-by: Konstantin Zharich <kostantin_zharich@epam.com>

author: yuleicul
message:
Add right-click menu for atoms (#1981)

* Add new dependency react-contexify

* Add new right-click menu for bonds

Resolves: #1872

* Fix stylelint and typo

* Divide context menu items into two components

* Change error handler to do nothing

* Remove the word `bond` out of context submenu item

* Extract common util functions to `utils.ts`

* Rename `ci` to `closestItem`

* Fix context menu not hiding when click left/bottom toolbar

* Make context menu id more readable

* Simplify usage of `fromBondsAttrs`

* Add right click menu for atoms

Depends on: #1896
Resolves: #1899

* Add atom single/batch operations
* Update logic in bond operations (more details in PR description)
* Make `changeAtomsStereoAction` static for invoking outside the class

* Refactor single atom stereo edit

* Update display orders of context menu items

Order before:
- Edit selected bond(s)
- Bond type
- Delete selected bond(s)
- Edit selected atom(s)
- Enhanced stereochemistry
- Delete selected atom(s)

Order after:
- Edit selected bond(s)
- Edit selected atom(s)
- Bond type
- Enhanced stereochemistry
- Delete selected bond(s)
- Delete selected atom(s)

* Update z-index of context menu

author: yuleicul
message:
Fix local `input` styles overriding other styles (#1767)

* Fix local `input` styles overriding other styles

There were `input` selectors lying in the outer-most layer of a `.less` file, which led to overriding other styles when importing the `less` file.

After going through all `.less` files, I found just one file having that problem. I changed the tag selector to its corresponding class selector. I've checked styles that may be affected by my changes to make sure everything works fine.

* Update selector `input` to `.input`

Resolves: #1694

* Fix prettier

* Remove un-used classname of fieldset

* Fix prettier

author: Zhirnoff
yuleicul
message:
#2142 S-Groups get lost when saving as ket file (#2168)

* Add S-Groups of multiple molecules to ket format file

* Remove S-Groups recorded in molecules of Ket file

Now in a ket file, all S-Groups either exist on the top layer (new version) or in the molecules (old version but compatible), which means there's no chance that some S-Groups exist on the top layer and some exist in the molecules

More details: https://excalidraw.com/#json=EBblE5uf7cDbf7WO5-iSU,aqAVNKUKnIKF3EZUtjXVsA

* Update test of serializing sgroup to ket format

author: gairon
message:
#2576 - Right click menu shown for highlighted functional group instead of clicked

* Show context menu for the closest item only if there is no selected item(s)
* Show context menu for a selection only if a user clicked on an item included in the selection
* Otherwise reset the current selection and show the context menu for the closest item
* Clear selection if a user clicks RMB outside of selection and other items
* Remove parentheses from menu items for General selection context menu
* Show "Edit selected atom..." menu item if atoms and something except bonds and Functional Groups are selected
* Show "Edit selected bonds..." menu item if bonds and something except atoms and Functional Groups are selected

author: Konstantin1996
message:
#2216 S-Group pop-up tool tip is positioned so that it overlaps structure (#2289)

* Change Calculation of the position for InfoPanel component. For template structure calculation do not change at all.
For now it calculates according to the green rectangle that appears when user hovering over the element.
Function calculateMiddleCoordsForRect calculate middle coord for each side of the rect.
After that panel appears relativly to the middle point of side.

- created WrapperPositionedRelativeToRectangle component.
- moved calculateScrollOffsetX , calculateScrollOffsetY into helpers.ts to reduce code duplication
- created calculateMiddleCoordsForRect accepts array of arrays [[1,2], [3,4], [3,4]] => [{ x: 2, y: 3 }, { x: 3, y: 4}]
- added wrapperRef on div to get dinamically changed width / height of the element

* - fixed issue with selection tool

* - fixed eslint error

* - fixed comments

---------

author: yuleicul
message:
Change global styles in `/example` to scoped styles (#1772)

* Change global styles in `/example` to scoped styles

There are two `.css` files in `/example` being imported directly, which expose global styles. Although these global styles haven't overridden any other styles so far, in case of potential risks, I change them to scoped styles by CSS module. Since the example app is using `create-react-app`, [CSS Module](https://create-react-app.dev/docs/adding-a-css-modules-stylesheet) is available.

* Fix prettier
